sentences.en: -- And then look inward, and discern the black reality of what they idolize?
sentences.cn: 可是 我再向自己的内心一看, 却辨出了他们所崇拜的东西中丑陋的真相!

sentences.en: Briefly speaking, young people inclined to idolize the people who excel in appearance, intelligence or talent.
sentences.cn: 总之, 青年人往往容易崇拜那些在外表 、 才华和特长方面极其出色的人.

sentences.en: Hong Kong teenagers idolize Cantopop stars more than their own parents, according to a university survey.
sentences.cn: 根据一所大学的研究,香港青少年崇拜粤语歌星超过自己的父母.

sentences.en: Idolize their favorite rappers and know all their songs.
sentences.cn: 把最喜欢的说唱歌手当成偶像崇拜，并且知道他们所有的歌。

sentences.en: If men could only know each other , they would neither idolize nor hate . -- Elbert Hubbert.
sentences.cn: 人和人仅凭了解, 不会崇拜,亦不会怨恨.

sentences.en: In all, modern novels with children perspective tend to idolize children while belittling adults.
sentences.cn: 总之, 儿童视角的写作倾向是尊孩子而贬成人的.
诸位女士, 我崇拜你们中的每一位.

sentences.en: Maggie : Could you possibly idolize her any more?
sentences.cn: 玛姬: 你可能盲目崇拜她 呢 ?

sentences.en: Putting up posters is one way fans can show who they idolize.
sentences.cn: 张贴海报是影迷们表示他们崇拜谁的一种方式.

sentences.en: The crowd grew larger every day, coming to question, to idolize, to scorn.
sentences.cn: 聚集拢来的鸥群一天天扩大, 有来问问题的,有来膜拜的, 有来嘲弄的,不一而足.

sentences.en: They had one child, a girl whom they idolized.
sentences.cn: 他们只有一个女儿，对这个孩子宠爱有加。

sentences.en: Those cross - Atlantic aficionados who persistently idolize the British theater and bad - mouth broadway ( Benedict Nightingale ).
sentences.cn: 那些持久地崇拜英国剧院而批评、贬低百老汇的 跨 大西洋的狂热者 ( 贝内迪克特·奈廷格尔 ).

sentences.en: We idolize success and status and thus undermine our mutual respect.
sentences.cn: 我们过度崇拜成功和地位,从而削弱了彼此间的尊重.

sentences.en: Your face I've memorized, I idolize just you.
sentences.cn: 我记忆中你的脸庞, 是我唯一的依恋.

words.tran_cn: 盲目崇拜的；崇拜偶像的
偶像崇拜者；崇拜者；皈依者
偶像崇拜；盲目崇拜；邪神崇拜

trans.tran_cn: 将…当作偶像崇拜； 极度仰慕， 崇拜
trans.tran_en: to admire and love someone so much that you think they are perfect
